font-size: 1.25rem; display: flex; align-items: center; justify-content: center; transition: var(--transition-fast); overflow: hidden; } body[data-theme="dark"] .theme-toggle-btn { background: var(--btn-secondary-bg-dark); border-color: var(--border-dark); } .theme-toggle-btn:hover { transform: rotate(15deg); } .icon-moon { display: none; } body[data-theme="dark"] .icon-sun { display: none; } body[data-theme="dark"] .icon-moon { display: block; } /* Settings Details */ .settings-details summary { cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; padding: 0.75rem 1rem; border-radius: 0.375rem; transition: var(--transition-fast); display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 0.5rem; } .settings-details summary:hover { background-color: var(--summary-hover-bg-light); } body[data-theme="dark"] .settings-details summary:hover { background-color: var(--summary-hover-bg-dark); } .settings-details[open] summary { background-color: var(--summary-hover-bg-light); } body[data-theme="dark"] .settings-details[open] summary { background-color: var(--summary-hover-bg-dark); } .collapsible-content { padding-top: 1.5rem; display: flex; flex-direction: column; gap: 1.5rem; } /* Status Box */ .status-box { padding: 0.75rem 1rem; margin-top: 1.5rem; border-radius: 0.375rem; text-align: center; font-weight: 500; font-size: 0.875rem; } .status-box.hidden { display: none; } .status-box.success { background-color: rgba(16, 185, 129, 0.1); color: var(--success-color); } .status-box.error { background-color: rgba(239, 68, 68, 0.1); color: var(--error-color); } /* Log Container */ .log-container { background-color: var(--bg-dark); color: #d1d5db; font-family: "SF Mono", "Consolas", "Menlo", monospace; font-size: 0.875rem; padding: 1rem; border-radius: 0.375rem; height: 300px; overflow-y: auto; white-space: pre-wrap; word-wrap: break-word; border: 1px solid var(--border-dark); } .log-placeholder { color: #6b7280; } .log-time { color: #6b7280; margin-right: 0.5rem; } .log-icon { margin-right: 0.5rem; } .log-container a { color: var(--primary-accent); text-decoration: none; } .log-container a:hover { text-decoration: underline; } /* Prompt Section */ #promptContainer { display: flex; flex-direction: column; gap: 0.75rem; } .prompt-item { display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 0.5rem; } .prompt-item .prompt-input { flex-grow: 1; } .prompt-item.used .prompt-input { text-decoration: line-through; color: var(--text-secondary-light); background-color: var(--btn-secondary-bg-light); } body[data-theme="dark"] .prompt-item.used .prompt-input { color: var(--text-secondary-dark); background-color: var(--btn-secondary-bg-dark); } .remove-prompt-btn { background-color: var(--btn-secondary-bg-light); color: var(--text-secondary-light); border: 1px solid var(--border-light); border-radius: 50%; width: 28px; height: 28px; font-size: 16px; cursor: pointer; flex-shrink: 0; transition: var(--transition-fast); } body[data-theme="dark"] .remove-prompt-btn { background-color: var(--btn-secondary-bg-dark); color: var(--text-secondary-dark); border-color: var(--border-dark); } .remove-prompt-btn:hover { background-color: #ef4444; color: white; border-color: #ef4444; } /* Image Source Selector */ .image-source-selector { display: flex; gap: 1.5rem; background-color: var(--summary-hover-bg-light); padding: 1rem; border-radius: 0.375rem; border: 1px solid var(--border-light); } body[data-theme="dark"] .image-source-selector { background-color: var(--summary-hover-bg-dark); border-color: var(--border-dark); } .image-source-selector label { display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 0.5rem; cursor: pointer; margin-bottom: 0; } /* YouTube Post Section */ .card-description { font-size: 0.875rem; color: var(--text-secondary-light); margin-top: -1rem; margin-bottom: 1.5rem; } body[data-theme="dark"] .card-description { color: var(--text-secondary-dark); } #youtubeUrlContainer { display: flex; flex-direction: column; gap: 0.75rem; } .youtube-url-item { display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 0.5rem; } .youtube-url-item .youtube-url-input { flex-grow: 1; } .remove-youtube-url-btn { background-color: var(--btn-secondary-bg-light); color: var(--text-secondary-light); border: 1px solid var(--border-light); border-radius: 50%; width: 28px; height: 28px; font-size: 16px; cursor: pointer; flex-shrink: 0; transition: var(--transition-fast); } body[data-theme="dark"] .remove-youtube-url-btn { background-color: var(--btn-secondary-bg-dark); color: var(--text-secondary-dark); border-color: var(--border-dark); } .remove-youtube-url-btn:hover { background-color: #ef4444; color: white; border-color: #ef4444; } /* History Section */ .history-controls { display: flex; justify-content: flex-end; margin-bottom: 1rem; } .history-list { list-style: none; padding: 0; margin: 0; display: flex; flex-direction: column; gap: 1rem; } .history-item { background-color: transparent; padding: 1rem; border-radius: 0.375rem; border: 1px solid var(--border-light); display: flex; justify-content: space-between; align-items: center; gap: 1rem; transition: var(--transition-fast); } body[data-theme="dark"] .history-item { border-color: var(--border-dark); } .history-item:hover { background-color: var(--summary-hover-bg-light); border-color: var(--primary-accent); } body[data-theme="dark"] .history-item:hover { background-color: var(--summary-hover-bg-dark); } .history-title { font-weight: 500; flex-grow: 1; } .history-details { display: flex; } .history-link { background-color: var(--primary-accent); color: white; padding: 0.375rem 0.75rem; border-radius: 0.25rem; text-decoration: none; font-size: 0.875rem; font-weight: 500; transition: var(--transition-fast); } .history-link:hover { background-color: #2563eb; } .history-placeholder { text-align: center; color: var(--text-secondary-light); padding: 2rem; list-style: none; border: 2px dashed var(--border-light); Modal Styles --- */ .modal-backdrop { position: fixed; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6); display: flex; justify-content: center; align-items: center; z-index: 1000; backdrop-filter: blur(5px); } .modal-content { background-color: var(--card-bg-light); padding: 2rem; border-radius: var(--border-radius); box-shadow: var(--box-shadow-lg); width: 90%; max-width: 800px; max-height: 90vh; display: flex; flex-direction: column; border: 1px solid var(--border-light); } body[data-theme="dark"] .modal-content { background-color: var(--card-bg-dark); border-color: var(--border-dark); } .modal-header { display: flex; justify-content: space-between; align-items: center; border-bottom: 1px solid var(--border-light); padding-bottom: 1rem; margin-bottom: 1.5rem; } body[data-theme="dark"] .modal-header { border-bottom-color: var(--border-dark); } .modal-header h2 { margin: 0; padding: 0; border: none; } .modal-close-btn { background: none; border: none; font-size: 1.75rem; cursor: pointer; color: var(--text-secondary-light); } body[data-theme="dark"] .modal-close-btn { color: var(--text-secondary-dark); } .modal-body { overflow-y: auto; } .modal-footer { display: flex; justify-content: flex-end; gap: 1rem; padding-top: 1.5rem; margin-top: 1.5rem; border-top: 1px solid var(--border-light); } body[data-theme="dark"] .modal-footer { border-top-color: var(--border-dark); } /* --- 7. Responsive Design --- */ @media (max-width: 768px) { body { padding: 1rem; } header { flex-direction: column; align-items: flex-start; gap: 1rem; } .main-grid { grid-template-columns: 1fr; } .history-item { flex-direction: column; align-items: flex-start; } .history-details { width: 100%; justify-content: space-between; margin-top: 0.75rem; } .image-source-selector { flex-direction: column; gap: 1rem; } } /* --- 8. Utility Classes --- */ .hidden { display: none; }

border-color: var(--border-dark); } .remove-youtube-url-btn:hover { background-color: #ef4444; color: white; border-color: #ef4444; } /* History Section */ .history-controls { display: flex; justify-content: flex-end; margin-bottom: 1rem; } .history-list { list-style: none; padding: 0; margin: 0; display: flex; flex-direction: column; gap: 1rem; } .history-item { background-color: transparent; padding: 1rem; border-radius: 0.375rem; border: 1px solid var(--border-light); display: flex; justify-content: space-between; align-items: center; gap: 1rem; transition: var(--transition-fast); } body[data-theme="dark"] .history-item { border-color: var(--border-dark); } .history-item:hover { background-color: var(--summary-hover-bg-light); border-color: var(--primary-accent); } body[data-theme="dark"] .history-item:hover { background-color: var(--summary-hover-bg-dark); } .history-title { font-weight: 500; flex-grow: 1; } .history-details { display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 1rem; flex-shrink: 0; } .history-date { font-size: 0.875rem; color: var(--text-secondary-light); } body[data-theme="dark"] .history-date { color: var(--text-secondary-dark); } .history-link { background-color: var(--primary-accent); color: white; padding: 0.375rem 0.75rem; border-radius: 0.25rem; text-decoration: none; font-size: 0.875rem; font-weight: 500; transition: var(--transition-fast); } .history-link:hover { background-color: #2563eb; } .history-placeholder { text-align: center; color: var(--text-secondary-light); padding: 2rem; list-style: none; border: 2px dashed var(--border-light); border-radius: var(--border-radius); } body[data-theme="dark"] .history-placeholder { color: var(--text-secondary-dark); border-color: var(--border-dark); } /* --- 6. Modal Styles --- */ .modal-backdrop { position: fixed; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6); display: flex; justify-content: center; align-items: center; z-index: 1000; backdrop-filter: blur(5px); } .modal-content { background-color: var(--card-bg-light); padding: 2rem; border-radius: var(--border-radius); box-shadow: var(--box-shadow-lg); width: 90%; max-width: 800px; max-height: 90vh; display: flex; flex-direction: column; border: 1px solid var(--border-light); } body[data-theme="dark"] .modal-content { background-color: var(--card-bg-dark); border-color: var(--border-dark); } .modal-header { display: flex; justify-content: space-between; align-items: center; border-bottom: 1px solid var(--border-light); padding-bottom: 1rem; margin-bottom: 1.5rem; } body[data-theme="dark"] .modal-header { border-bottom-color: var(--border-dark); } .modal-header h2 { margin: 0; padding: 0; border: none; } .modal-close-btn { background: none; border: none; font-size: 1.75rem; cursor: pointer; color: var(--text-secondary-light); } body[data-theme="dark"] .modal-close-btn { color: var(--text-secondary-dark); } .modal-body { overflow-y: auto; } .modal-footer { display: flex; justify-content: flex-end; gap: 1rem; padding-top: 1.5rem; margin-top: 1.5rem; border-top: 1px solid var(--border-light); } body[data-theme="dark"] .modal-footer { border-top-color: var(--border-dark); } /* --- 7. Responsive Design --- */ @media (max-width: 768px) { body { padding: 1rem; } header { flex-direction: column; align-items: flex-start; gap: 1rem; } .main-grid { grid-template-columns: 1fr; } .history-item { flex-direction: column; align-items: flex-start; } .history-details { width: 100%; justify-content: space-between; margin-top: 0.75rem; } .image-source-selector { flex-direction: column; gap: 1rem; } } /* --- 8. Utility Classes --- */ .hidden { display: none !important; } { "name": "google-blog-generator", "private": true, "version": "0.0.0", "type": "module", "scripts": { "dev": "concurrently --kill-others \"vite --host\" \"node server.js\"", "build": "vite build", "preview": "vite preview" }, "dependencies": { "@google/generative-ai": "^0.11.4", "axios": "^1.7.2", "body-parser": "^1.20.2", "cors": "^2.8.5", "express": "^4.19.2", "youtube-transcript": "^1.2.1" }, "devDependencies": { "vite": "^5.2.0", "concurrently": "^8.2.2" } }

annotations.summary:
---
# Project Overview
- **Project**: rastver5 - A web application, likely for content generation.
- **Current Phase**: Initial Setup & Feature Refinement
- **Tech Stack**: JavaScript, Node.js, HTML, CSS
- **Environment**: Local development environment started with `npm run dev`.

# Conversation Context
- **Last Topic**: Issues with the "YouTube generation" feature and a request for new functionality.
- **Key Decisions**: The project codebase has been imported and the development server has been started.
- **User Context**:
  - Technical Level: Intermediate (understands project setup, provides specific bug reports and feature requests).
  - Preferences: Prefers a previous, unspecified method for image handling.
  - Communication: Direct, provides clear instructions and feedback (in Korean).

# Implementation Status
## Current State
- **Active Feature**: YouTube Generation Feature
- **Progress**: The application is running, but the YouTube generation feature is faulty.
- **Blockers**: An error occurs when using the YouTube generation feature, and its image handling is considered ambiguous/problematic.

## Code Evolution
- **Recent Changes**: Initial import of project files from the "rastver5" folder.
- **Working Patterns**: The application successfully installs dependencies (`npm install`) and starts (`npm run dev`).
- **Failed Approaches**: The current implementation for handling images in the YouTube generation feature is not meeting user requirements.

# Requirements
- **Implemented**: Project setup from the "rastver5" folder.
- **In Progress**: Debugging the YouTube generation feature.
- **Pending**: Revert to a previous image handling method; implement a direct user image upload feature.
- **Technical Constraints**: None specified yet.

# Critical Memory
- **Must Preserve**: The core issue is a bug and ambiguous image handling within the YouTube generation feature.
- **User Requirements**: Fix the YouTube generation error, restore a previous image handling method, and add a direct image upload capability.
- **Known Issues**: The YouTube generation function is buggy.

# Next Actions
- **Immediate**: Investigate the error in the YouTube generation feature.
- **Open Questions**: What was the "previously used method" for image handling? What is the specific error message or behavior when YouTube generation fails?

 /* --- Design System: "Project Premium" --- */ /* --- 1. Root & Color Variables --- */ :root { --font-sans: 'Inter', -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, "Segoe UI", Roboto, "Helvetica Neue", Arial, sans-serif; /* Light Theme */ --bg-light: #f7f8fa; --card-bg-light: #ffffff; --text-primary-light: #1a202c; --text-secondary-light: #718096; --border-light: #e2e8f0; --input-bg-light: #ffffff; --btn-secondary-bg-light: #f1f5f9; --btn-secondary-hover-bg-light: #e2e8f0; --summary-hover-bg-light: #f8fafc; /* Dark Theme */ --bg-dark: #121212; --card-bg-dark: #1e1e1e; --text-primary-dark: #e2e8f0; --text-secondary-dark: #a0aec0; --border-dark: #2d3748; --input-bg-dark: #2d3748; --btn-secondary-bg-dark: #2d3748; --btn-secondary-hover-bg-dark: #4a5568; --summary-hover-bg-dark: #2d3748; /* Universal Colors */ --primary-accent: #3b82f6; --primary-gradient: linear-gradient(45deg, #3b82f6, #8b5cf6); --primary-gradient-hover: linear-gradient(45deg, #2563eb, #7c3aed); --success-color: #10b981; --error-color: #ef4444; --warning-color: #f97316; --box-shadow: 0 4px 6px -1px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1), 0 2px 4px -1px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.06); --box-shadow-lg: 0 10px 15px -3px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1), 0 4px 6px -2px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.05); --border-radius: 0.5rem; /* 8px */ --transition-fast: all 0.2s ease-in-out; } body { font-family: var(--font-sans); margin: 0; padding: 2rem; line-height: 1.6; background-color: var(--bg-light); color: var(--text-primary-light); transition: background-color 0.3s, color 0.3s; } body[data-theme="dark"] { background-color: var(--bg-dark); color: var(--text-primary-dark); } /* --- 2. Layout & Structure --- */ .container { max-width: 1200px; margin: 0 auto; } header { display: flex; justify-content: space-between; align-items: center; margin-bottom: 2.5rem; padding-bottom: 1.5rem; border-bottom: 1px solid var(--border-light); } body[data-theme="dark"] header { border-bottom-color: var(--border-dark); } header h1 { font-size: 1.875rem; /* 30px */ font-weight: 700; margin: 0; } header p { font-size: 1rem; color: var(--text-secondary-light); margin: 0.25rem 0 0; } body[data-theme="dark"] header p { color: var(--text-secondary-dark); } .main-grid { display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(400px, 1fr)); gap: 1.5rem; } .grid-col { display: flex; flex-direction: column; gap: 1.5rem; } /* --- 3. Card Styles --- */ .card { background-color: var(--card-bg-light); border-radius: var(--border-radius); box-shadow: var(--box-shadow); padding: 1.75rem; border: 1px solid var(--border-light); transition: var(--transition-fast); } body[data-theme="dark"] .card { background-color: var(--card-bg-dark); border-color: var(--border-dark); } .card:hover { transform: translateY(-3px); box-shadow: var(--box-shadow-lg); } .card h2 { margin-top: 0; font-size: 1.25rem; /* 20px */ font-weight: 600; border-bottom: 1px solid var(--border-light); padding-bottom: 0.75rem; margin-bottom: 1.5rem; } body[data-theme="dark"] .card h2 { border-color: var(--border-dark); } /* --- 4. Form & Button Styles --- */ .form-group { margin-bottom: 1.25rem; } .form-group:last-child { margin-bottom: 0; } .form-group label { display: block; font-weight: 500; margin-bottom: 0.5rem; font-size: 0.875rem; } .form-group input[type="text"], .form-group input[type="password"], .form-group select, .form-group textarea, .form-group .file-input { width: 100%; padding: 0.75rem 1rem; border: 1px solid var(--border-light); border-radius: 0.375rem; /* 6px */ box-sizing: border-box; transition: var(--transition-fast); background-color: var(--input-bg-light); color: var(--text-primary-light); font-size: 1rem; font-family: var(--font-sans); } body[data-theme="dark"] .form-group input[type="text"], body[data-theme="dark"] .form-group input[type="password"], body[data-theme="dark"] .form-group select, body[data-theme="dark"] .form-group textarea, body[data-theme="dark"] .form-group .file-input { background-color: var(--input-bg-dark); border-color: var(--border-dark); color: var(--text-primary-dark); } .form-group input:focus, .form-group select:focus, .form-group textarea:focus, .form-group .file-input:focus { outline: none; border-color: var(--primary-accent); box-shadow: 0 0 0 3px rgba(59, 130, 246, 0.2); } .form-group .file-input { padding: 0.5rem; } .checkbox-label { display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 0.5rem; cursor: pointer; } .button-primary, .button-secondary, .button-google { padding: 0.75rem 1.25rem; border: none; border-radius: 0.375rem; font-size: 1rem; font-weight: 600; cursor: pointer; transition: var(--transition-fast); display: inline-flex; align-items: center; justify-content: center; gap: 0.5rem; } .button-primary { background: var(--primary-gradient); color: white; box-shadow: 0 1px 3px 0 rgba(0,0,0,.1), 0 1px 2px 0 rgba(0,0,0,.06); } .button-primary:hover { background: var(--primary-gradient-hover); transform: translateY(-1px); box-shadow: var(--box-shadow); } .button-primary:disabled { background: #9ca3af; color: #e5e7eb; cursor: not-allowed; transform: none; box-shadow: none; } .button-secondary { background-color: var(--btn-secondary-bg-light); color: var(--text-primary-light); border: 1px solid var(--border-light); } body[data-theme="dark"] .button-secondary { background-color: var(--btn-secondary-bg-dark); color: var(--text-primary-dark); border-color: var(--border-dark); } .button-secondary:hover { background-color: var(--btn-secondary-hover-bg-light); } body[data-theme="dark"] .button-secondary:hover { background-color: var(--btn-secondary-hover-bg-dark); } .button-google { background-color: #fff; color: #374151; border: 1px solid #d1d5db; } .button-google:hover { background-color: #f9fafb; } .google-icon { width: 18px; height: 18px; } .main-actions { display: flex; gap: 1rem; margin-top: 1.5rem; } /* --- 5. Specific Components --- */ /* Theme Toggle */ .theme-toggle-btn { background: var(--btn-secondary-bg-light); border: 1px solid var(--border-light); width: 44px; height: 44px; border-radius: 50%; cursor: pointer; font-size: 1.25rem; display: flex; align-items: center; justify-content: center; transition: var(--transition-fast); overflow: hidden; } body[data-theme="dark"] .theme-toggle-btn { background: var(--btn-secondary-bg-dark); border-color: var(--border-dark); } .theme-toggle-btn:hover { transform: rotate(15deg); } .icon-moon { display: none; } body[data-theme="dark"] .icon-sun { display: none; } body[data-theme="dark"] .icon-moon { display: block; } /* Settings Details */ .settings-details summary { cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; padding: 0.75rem 1rem; border-radius: 0.375rem; transition: var(--transition-fast); display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 0.5rem; } .settings-details summary:hover { background-color: var(--summary-hover-bg-light); } body[data-theme="dark"] .settings-details summary:hover { background-color: var(--summary-hover-bg-dark); } .settings-details[open] summary { background-color: var(--summary-hover-bg-light); } body[data-theme="dark"] .settings-details[open] summary { background-color: var(--summary-hover-bg-dark); } .collapsible-content { padding-top: 1.5rem; display: flex; flex-direction: column; gap: 1.5rem; } /* Status Box */ .status-box { padding: 0.75rem 1rem; margin-top: 1.5rem; border-radius: 0.375rem; text-align: center; font-weight: 500; font-size: 0.875rem; } .status-box.hidden { display: none; } .status-box.success { background-color: rgba(16, 185, 129, 0.1); color: var(--success-color); } .status-box.error { background-color: rgba(239, 68, 68, 0.1); color: var(--error-color); } /* Log Container */ .log-container { background-color: var(--bg-dark); color: #d1d5db; font-family: "SF Mono", "Consolas", "Menlo", monospace; font-size: 0.875rem; padding: 1rem; border-radius: 0.375rem; height: 300px; overflow-y: auto; white-space: pre-wrap; word-wrap: break-word; border: 1px solid var(--border-dark); } .log-placeholder { color: #6b7280; } .log-time { color: #6b7280; margin-right: 0.5rem; } .log-icon { margin-right: 0.5rem; } .log-container a { color: var(--primary-accent); text-decoration: none; } .log-container a:hover { text-decoration: underline; } /* Prompt Section */ #promptContainer { display: flex; flex-direction: column; gap: 0.75rem; } .prompt-item { display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 0.5rem; } .prompt-item .prompt-input { flex-grow: 1; } .prompt-item.used .prompt-input { text-decoration: line-through; color: var(--text-secondary-light); background-color: var(--btn-secondary-bg-light); } body[data-theme="dark"] .prompt-item.used .prompt-input { color: var(--text-secondary-dark); background-color: var(--btn-secondary-bg-dark); } .remove-prompt-btn { background-color: var(--btn-secondary-bg-light); color: var(--text-secondary-light); border: 1px solid var(--border-light); border-radius: 50%; width: 28px; height: 28px; font-size: 16px; cursor: pointer; flex-shrink: 0; transition: var(--transition-fast); } body[data-theme="dark"] .remove-prompt-btn { background-color: var(--btn-secondary-bg-dark); color: var(--text-secondary-dark); border-color: var(--border-dark); } .remove-prompt-btn:hover { background-color: #ef4444; color: white; border-color: #ef4444; } /* Image Source Selector */ .image-source-selector { display: flex; flex-wrap: wrap; gap: 1rem 1.5rem; background-color: var(--summary-hover-bg-light); padding: 1rem; border-radius: 0.375rem; border: 1px solid var(--border-light); } body[data-theme="dark"] .image-source-selector { background-color: var(--summary-hover-bg-dark); border-color: var(--border-dark); } .image-source-selector label { display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 0.5rem; cursor: pointer; margin-bottom: 0; } /* Image Upload Preview */ .image-preview-container { margin-top: 1rem; position: relative; width: 100%; max-width: 200px; border: 1px solid var(--border-light); border-radius: 0.375rem; padding: 0.5rem; } body[data-theme="dark"] .image-preview-container { border-color: var(--border-dark); } #imagePreview { width: 100%; height: auto; display: block; border-radius: 0.25rem; } .remove-image-btn { position: absolute; top: -10px; right: -10px; background-color: var(--error-color); color: white; border: 2px solid var(--card-bg-light); border-radius: 50%; width: 24px; height: 24px; font-size: 14px; line-height: 20px; text-align: center; cursor: pointer; transition: var(--transition-fast); } body[data-theme="dark"] .remove-image-btn { border-color: var(--card-bg-dark); } .remove-image-btn:hover { transform: scale(1.1); } /* YouTube Post Section */ .card-description { font-size: 0.875rem; color: var(--text-secondary-light); margin-top: -1rem; margin-bottom: 1.5rem; } body[data-theme="dark"] .card-description { color: var(--text-secondary-dark); } #youtubeUrlContainer { display: flex; flex-direction: column; gap: 0.75rem; } .youtube-url-item { display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 0.5rem; } .youtube-url-item .youtube-url-input { flex-grow: 1; } .remove-youtube-url-btn { background-color: var(--btn-secondary-bg-light); color: var(--text-secondary-light); border: 1px solid var(--border-light); border-radius: 50%; width: 28px; height: 28px; font-size: 16px; cursor: pointer; flex-shrink: 0; transition: var(--transition-fast); } body[data-theme="dark"] .remove-youtube-url-btn { background-color: var(--btn-secondary-bg-dark); color: var(--text-secondary-dark); border-color: var(--border-dark); } .remove-youtube-url-btn:hover { background-color: #ef4444; color: white; border-color: #ef4444; } /* History Section */ .history-controls { display: flex; justify-content: flex-end; margin-bottom: 1rem; } .history-list { list-style: none; padding: 0; margin: 0; display: flex; flex-direction: column; gap: 1rem; } .history-item { background-color: transparent; padding: 1rem; border-radius: 0.375rem; border: 1px solid var(--border-light); display: flex; justify-content: space-between; align-items: center; gap: 1rem; transition: var(--transition-fast); } body[data-theme="dark"] .history-item { border-color: var(--border-dark); } .history-item:hover { background-color: var(--summary-hover-bg-light); border-color: var(--primary-accent); } body[data-theme="dark"] .history-item:hover { background-color: var(--summary-hover-bg-dark); } .history-title { font-weight: 500; flex-grow: 1; } .history-details { display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 1rem; flex-shrink: 0; } .history-date { font-size: 0.875rem; color: var(--text-secondary-light); } body[data-theme="dark"] .history-date { color: var(--text-secondary-dark); } .history-link { background-color: var(--primary-accent); color: white; padding: 0.375rem 0.75rem; border-radius: 0.25rem; text-decoration: none; font-size: 0.875rem; font-weight: 500; transition: var(--transition-fast); } .history-link:hover { background-color: #2563eb; } .history-placeholder { text-align: center; color: var(--text-secondary-light); padding: 2rem; list-style: none; border: 2px dashed var(--border-light); border-radius: var(--border-radius); } body[data-theme="dark"] .history-placeholder { color: var(--text-secondary-dark); border-color: var(--border-dark); } /* --- 6. Modal Styles --- */ .modal-backdrop { position: fixed; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6); display: flex; justify-content: center; align-items: center; z-index: 1000; backdrop-filter: blur(5px); } .modal-content { background-color: var(--card-bg-light); padding: 2rem; border-radius: var(--border-radius); box-shadow: var(--box-shadow-lg); width: 90%; max-width: 800px; max-height: 90vh; display: flex; flex-direction: column; border: 1px solid var(--border-light); } body[data-theme="dark"] .modal-content { background-color: var(--card-bg-dark); border-color: var(--border-dark); } .modal-header { display: flex; justify-content: space-between; align-items: center; border-bottom: 1px solid var(--border-light); padding-bottom: 1rem; margin-bottom: 1.5rem; } body[data-theme="dark"] .modal-header { border-bottom-color: var(--border-dark); } .modal-header h2 { margin: 0; padding: 0; border: none; } .modal-close-btn { background: none; border: none; font-size: 1.75rem; cursor: pointer; color: var(--text-secondary-light); } body[data-theme="dark"] .modal-close-btn { color: var(--text-secondary-dark); } .modal-body { overflow-y: auto; } .modal-footer { display: flex; justify-content: flex-end; gap: 1rem; padding-top: 1.5rem; margin-top: 1.5rem; border-top: 1px solid var(--border-light); } body[data-theme="dark"] .modal-footer { border-top-color: var(--border-dark); } /* --- 7. Responsive Design --- */ @media (max-width: 768px) { body { padding: 1rem; } header { flex-direction: column; align-items: flex-start; gap: 1rem; } .main-grid { grid-template-columns: 1fr; } .history-item { flex-direction: column; align-items: flex-start; } .history-details { width: 100%; justify-content: space-between; margin-top: 0.75rem; } .image-source-selector { flex-direction: column; gap: 1rem; } } /* --- 8. Utility & New Feature Styles --- */ .hidden { display: none !important; } .divider { border: none; border-top: 1px solid var(--border-light); margin: 1.5rem 0; } body[data-theme="dark"] .divider { border-top-color: var(--border-dark); } .warning-text { font-size: 0.8rem; color: var(--warning-color); margin-top: 0.5rem; padding: 0.5rem; background-color: rgba(249, 115, 22, 0.05); border-radius: 0.25rem; border-left: 3px solid var(--warning-color); } .shutdown-status-container { background-color: rgba(249, 115, 22, 0.1); border: 1px solid var(--warning-color); color: var(--warning-color); padding: 1rem; border-radius: var(--border-radius); display: flex; justify-content: space-between; align-items: center; font-weight: 600; } .shutdown-status-container p { margin: 0; } .shutdown-status-container .button-secondary { border-color: var(--warning-color); # Project Overview
- **Project**: rastver5 - A web application for automated content generation and posting.
- **Current Phase**: Troubleshooting & Feature Enhancement
- **Tech Stack**: JavaScript, Node.js, HTML, CSS, youtube-transcript
- **Environment**: Local development environment.

# Conversation Context
- **Last Topic**: The YouTube content generation feature fails when a video lacks a transcript, and the user is asking for a workaround.
- **Key Decisions**: The "Auto Shutdown" feature was implemented with a 60-second delay and cancellation option. The current YouTube implementation relies on pre-existing transcripts.
- **User Context**:
  - Technical Level: Intermediate, with a strong understanding of product strategy, UX, and technical risks.
  - Preferences: Prefers robust features that handle edge cases.
  - Communication: Provides highly detailed, well-structured feature specifications in Korean.

# Implementation Status
## Current State
- **Active Feature**: Troubleshooting the YouTube content generation feature.
- **Progress**: The verification test for the YouTube feature revealed a critical failure. The feature works for videos with transcripts but fails for those without, showing an error message.
- **Blockers**: The `youtube-transcript` library cannot extract text if the source video does not have subtitles or an auto-generated transcript.

## Code Evolution
- **Recent Changes**: No new code has been written. The focus shifted from verification to debugging after a feature limitation was discovered.
- **Working Patterns**: The user verifies implemented features, which successfully uncovered a significant edge case.
- **Failed Approaches**: The current approach of relying solely on the `youtube-transcript` library is insufficient as it does not support videos without transcripts.

# Requirements
- **Implemented**: Project setup, Direct user image upload, "Auto Shutdown" feature for Windows.
- **In Progress**: Fixing the YouTube content generation feature to handle videos without transcripts.
- **Pending**: Implement a method to extract text from videos that lack subtitles (e.g., audio transcription).
- **Technical Constraints**: The "Auto Shutdown" feature is Windows-specific. The YouTube feature is currently limited by the availability of video transcripts.

# Critical Memory
- **Must Preserve**: The "Auto Shutdown" feature is a high-risk function with specific safety measures. The YouTube feature's dependency on the `youtube-transcript` library is its current point of failure.
- **User Requirements**: The application must be able to generate content from a YouTube video even if it does not have a pre-existing transcript.
- **Known Issues**: The system shows an error "Cannot extract a valid script from the video. Please check if the video has subtitles." for videos without transcripts.

# Next Actions
- **Immediate**: Investigate and propose solutions for extracting text from YouTube videos that do not have transcripts.
- **Open Questions**: How can we extract content from a YouTube video if it does not have a script or subtitles?

# Project Overview
- **Project**: rastver5 - A web application for automated content generation and posting.
- **Current Phase**: Debugging & Refinement
- **Tech Stack**: JavaScript, Node.js, HTML, CSS, youtube-transcript, ytdl-core
- **Environment**: Local development environment.

# Conversation Context
- **Last Topic**: A specific YouTube video with a transcript is failing to be processed, even after implementing a fallback solution.
- **Key Decisions**: Implemented a fallback mechanism: if `youtube-transcript` fails, use `ytdl-core` to extract audio and transcribe it with Gemini 1.5 Pro.
- **User Context**:
  - Technical Level: Intermediate, actively tests features and provides specific failure cases.
  - Preferences: Prefers robust features that handle edge cases.
  - Communication: Provides highly detailed, well-structured feature specifications and direct feedback.

# Implementation Status
## Current State
- **Active Feature**: Debugging the YouTube content generation feature.
- **Progress**: A fallback for videos without transcripts was implemented. However, the user found a video that has a transcript but still fails extraction.
- **Blockers**: The system fails to process a specific video (`https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BQJC4rYtqLA...`), preventing successful content generation from it.

## Code Evolution
- **Recent Changes**: Added `ytdl-core` dependency. Modified `server.js` to attempt transcription with `youtube-transcript` and, upon failure, fall back to extracting audio for AI-based transcription.
- **Working Patterns**: Assistant proposes and implements a solution; user verifies it with real-world examples, uncovering new edge cases.
- **Failed Approaches**: Relying solely on `youtube-transcript` was insufficient. The new combined approach is also failing for certain videos.

# Requirements
- **Implemented**: Project setup, Direct user image upload, "Auto Shutdown" feature.
- **In Progress**: Fixing the YouTube content generation feature to reliably handle all types of videos (with/without transcripts).
- **Pending**: A stable and robust YouTube video processing pipeline.
- **Technical Constraints**: The "Auto Shutdown" feature is Windows-specific. YouTube feature reliability is still a challenge.

# Critical Memory
- **Must Preserve**: The system now has a two-step process for YouTube videos: `youtube-transcript` first, then an audio-extraction fallback using `ytdl-core` and Gemini.
- **User Requirements**: The application must be able to generate content from any given YouTube video link.
- **Known Issues**: The system fails to extract a script from `https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BQJC4rYtqLA&t=12s` even though it appears to have one.

# Next Actions
- **Immediate**: Investigate why the provided YouTube URL fails. Determine if the issue is with the initial script detection or the extraction library itself.
- **Open Questions**: Why is the script extraction failing for the specific video provided by the user? Is the transcript format unsupported or is the detection logic flawed?

annotations.summary:
---
# Project Overview
- **Project**: rastver5 - A web application for automated content generation and posting.
- **Current Phase**: Feature Expansion & Debugging
- **Tech Stack**: JavaScript, Node.js, HTML, CSS, youtube-transcript, ytdl-core
- **Environment**: Local development environment.

# Conversation Context
- **Last Topic**: Expanding AI model options and adding cost warnings.
- **Key Decisions**: Improve the audio extraction fallback by making audio format selection more flexible. Add functionality to select from multiple AI models and include a warning about potential costs with higher-tier models.
- **User Context**:
  - Technical Level: Intermediate, focused on robustness and feature expansion.
  - Preferences: Prefers robust, flexible features with user-facing controls (e.g., model selection) and clear warnings.
  - Communication: Provides direct feature requests and specifications.

# Implementation Status
## Current State
- **Active Feature**: Enhancing the YouTube content generation feature.
- **Progress**: A fix was proposed to make the audio-extraction fallback more robust by improving audio format detection. The user has requested adding more AI models and a cost warning.
- **Blockers**: The core YouTube processing logic needs to be updated with the proposed fix and the new multi-model feature.

## Code Evolution
- **Recent Changes**: A proposed update to `server.js` to improve `transcribeAudioWithGemini` by adding flexible audio format selection and more detailed logging.
- **Working Patterns**: Assistant provides technical fixes for reported issues; user validates and requests new, related features.
- **Failed Approaches**: The initial audio-extraction fallback was not robust enough as it only looked for a specific audio format (`m4a`), causing failures.

# Requirements
- **Implemented**: Project setup, Direct user image upload, "Auto Shutdown" feature.
- **In Progress**: Fixing the YouTube video processing pipeline. Implementing a multi-AI model selection feature. Adding a cost/token usage warning to the UI.
- **Pending**: A fully stable and flexible YouTube content generation module.
- **Technical Constraints**: The "Auto Shutdown" feature is Windows-specific.

# Critical Memory
- **Must Preserve**: The YouTube processing flow is: 1) `youtube-transcript`, 2) fallback to `ytdl-core` audio extraction + Gemini transcription. The fallback logic is being improved for format flexibility.
- **User Requirements**: The app must handle any YouTube link. Users should be able to choose different AI models for transcription and be warned about the potential costs of higher-tier models.
- **Known Issues**: The system was failing on specific videos (e.g., `BQJC4rYtqLA`) due to rigid audio format handling in the fallback; a fix has been proposed.

# Next Actions
- **Immediate**: Implement the proposed robustness fix for audio transcription in `server.js`. Begin work on adding UI and backend logic for selecting different AI models and displaying a cost warning.
- **Open Questions**: Which specific AI models should be added? What should the exact text of the cost warning be?

annotations.summary:
---
# Project Overview
- **Project**: rastver5 - A web application for automated content generation and posting.
- **Current Phase**: Feature Expansion & Debugging
- **Tech Stack**: JavaScript, Node.js, HTML, CSS, youtube-transcript, ytdl-core
- **Environment**: Local development environment.

# Conversation Context
- **Last Topic**: Automatic labeling for Google Blogger posts.
- **Key Decisions**: Implement automatic labeling for Google Blogger posts and add a UI notification to inform the user. The implementation of multi-AI model selection with cost warnings was confirmed.
- **User Context**:
  - Technical Level: Intermediate, focused on robustness and feature expansion.
  - Preferences: Prefers robust, automated features with clear user-facing information.
  - Communication: Provides direct feature requests and specifications.

# Implementation Status
## Current State
- **Active Feature**: Implementing multi-AI model selection and adding automatic labeling for Google Blogger posts.
- **Progress**: Code for AI model selection and cost warnings has been provided. The request for automatic Blogger labeling has just been made.
- **Blockers**: None. Awaiting implementation of the new labeling feature.

## Code Evolution
- **Recent Changes**: `index.html` and `script.js` were updated to add a dropdown for selecting various AI models and to display a cost warning for higher-tier models.
- **Working Patterns**: Assistant provides code for requested features; user validates and introduces new requirements.
- **Failed Approaches**: The initial audio-extraction fallback was not robust enough, which has been addressed in prior discussions.

# Requirements
- **Implemented**: Project setup, Direct user image upload, "Auto Shutdown" feature.
- **In Progress**: Implementing a multi-AI model selection feature with cost warnings. Adding automatic labeling for Google Blogger posts.
- **Pending**: A fully stable and flexible YouTube content generation module.
- **Technical Constraints**: The "Auto Shutdown" feature is Windows-specific.

# Critical Memory
- **Must Preserve**: The YouTube processing flow uses `youtube-transcript` with a `ytdl-core` audio extraction fallback. The app should support multiple AI models.
- **User Requirements**: The app must handle any YouTube link. Users should be able to choose different AI models and be warned about costs. Google Blogger posts should have labels added automatically, and the user should be notified of this.
- **Known Issues**: The system was previously failing on specific videos due to rigid audio format handling; a fix was proposed.

# Next Actions
- **Immediate**: Implement the automatic labeling feature for Google Blogger posts. Add a UI message to inform users that labels are added automatically.
- **Open Questions**: Does the Google Blogger posting function already include labeling? If not, what logic should be used to generate the labels?

annotations.summary:
---
# Project Overview
- **Project**: rastver5 - A web application for automated content generation and posting.
- **Current Phase**: Feature Expansion & Usability Improvement
- **Tech Stack**: JavaScript, Node.js, HTML, CSS, youtube-transcript, ytdl-core
- **Environment**: Local development environment.

# Conversation Context
- **Last Topic**: Providing guidance for users to obtain necessary API keys and IDs.
- **Key Decisions**: Implement automatic labeling for Blogger posts by extracting AI-generated keywords. A new request was made to add an instructional guide for obtaining Google API keys and Blog ID.
- **User Context**:
  - Technical Level: Intermediate, with a strong focus on user experience for beginners.
  - Preferences: Prefers robust, automated features with clear user-facing information and setup guides.
  - Communication: Provides direct feature requests and identifies potential user pain points.

# Implementation Status
## Current State
- **Active Feature**: Implementing automatic Blogger post labeling and designing a setup guide for API keys.
- **Progress**: Code for the auto-labeling feature has been provided. The user has requested a new guide for API key setup.
- **Blockers**: None, awaiting implementation of the user guide for API keys.

## Code Evolution
- **Recent Changes**: Assistant proposed changes to `index.html` and `script.js` to add a 'Labels' field in the preview modal, populated automatically from AI-generated keywords found in an HTML comment (`<!-- keywords: ... -->`).
- **Working Patterns**: Assistant provides code for a feature, and the user validates it while also considering the end-user's setup experience.
- **Failed Approaches**: None in the recent conversation.

# Requirements
- **Implemented**: Project setup, Direct user image upload, "Auto Shutdown" feature, Multi-AI model selection.
- **In Progress**: Automatic labeling for Google Blogger posts.
- **Pending**: A user-friendly guide/modal for obtaining Google Gemini API Key, OAuth 2.0 Client ID, and Blog ID.
- **Technical Constraints**: The "Auto Shutdown" feature is Windows-specific.

# Critical Memory
- **Must Preserve**: The auto-labeling logic extracts keywords from an HTML comment (`<!-- keywords: ... -->`) and presents them to the user for confirmation before posting.
- **User Requirements**: The app must guide non-technical users on how to acquire necessary credentials (Gemini API Key, OAuth Client ID, Blog ID).
- **Known Issues**: The initial setup process is considered difficult for beginners due to the need for multiple API keys and IDs.

# Next Actions
- **Immediate**: Create an instructional pop-up or guide to help users get their Google Gemini API key, Google OAuth 2.0 client ID, and Target Blog ID.
- **Open Questions**: How should the guide for obtaining API keys be presented to the user (e.g., a modal, a separate help page)?

annotations.summary:
---
# Project Overview
- **Project**: rastver5 - A web application for automated content generation and posting.
- **Current Phase**: Architectural Redesign & Feature Tiering
- **Tech Stack**: JavaScript, Node.js, HTML, CSS, youtube-transcript, ytdl-core
- **Environment**: Local development environment.

# Conversation Context
- **Last Topic**: Comparing a client-side help modal vs. a server-driven OAuth 2.0 flow for user setup.
- **Key Decisions**: To adopt a tiered feature strategy. A simple "Help Modal" will be for a standard version, while a more user-friendly "Server-Driven OAuth" flow will be implemented for a premium version. The user has reported an error with the last code provided.
- **User Context**:
  - Technical Level: Advanced, with a deep understanding of OAuth 2.0, security, and product strategy.
  - Preferences: Prefers server-side solutions for security and ultimate user convenience over client-side helpers.
  - Communication: Provides detailed architectural proposals and direct feedback on errors.

# Implementation Status
## Current State
- **Active Feature**: Debugging the API key help modal and designing the server-driven OAuth flow.
- **Progress**: Assistant provided code for a help modal, but the user reported an error. The architectural design for a server-driven OAuth flow has been proposed by the user.
- **Blockers**: An unspecified error in the assistant's last code submission for the help modal needs to be resolved.

## Code Evolution
- **Recent Changes**: Assistant provided code for a help modal using HTML, CSS, and JS.
- **Working Patterns**: User provides high-level architectural direction (e.g., server-driven OAuth), and the assistant is expected to provide the implementation.
- **Failed Approaches**: The client-side "Help Modal" approach was deemed insufficient for a premium user experience and has been superseded by the server-driven OAuth plan. The provided code for it is also currently buggy.

# Requirements
- **Implemented**: Project setup, Direct user image upload, "Auto Shutdown" feature, Multi-AI model selection, Automatic labeling for Blogger posts.
- **In Progress**: Server-driven OAuth 2.0 authentication flow (Premium Tier). Debugging the API key help modal (Standard Tier).
- **Pending**: Finalizing the implementation for Standard vs. Premium tiers.
- **Technical Constraints**: The "Auto Shutdown" feature is Windows-specific. The new OAuth flow requires significant backend logic for handling secrets and tokens.

# Critical Memory
- **Must Preserve**: The decision to implement two user setup flows: a manual one with a help modal (Standard) and an automated server-driven OAuth flow (Premium).
- **User Requirements**: The premium version must be extremely simple, requiring only a "Login with Google" click and consent, abstracting away all Google Cloud Console interactions.
- **Known Issues**: The code provided for the "Help Modal" feature is causing an unspecified error.

# Next Actions
- **Immediate**: Debug and fix the error in the previously provided code for the API key help modal.
- **Open Questions**: How to structure the backend for the server-driven OAuth flow? Should we proceed with the premium feature implementation after fixing the current error?

---

annotations.summary:
---
# Project Overview
- **Project**: rastver5 - A web application for automated content generation and posting.
- **Current Phase**: Architectural Redesign & Feature Tiering
- **Tech Stack**: JavaScript, Node.js, HTML, CSS, youtube-transcript, ytdl-core
- **Environment**: Local development environment.

# Conversation Context
- **Last Topic**: Pivoting development priority from the Standard tier to the Premium tier.
- **Key Decisions**: The user has directed to build the "Premium" version with server-driven OAuth 2.0 first. The "Standard" version will be derived from it later by removing features.
- **User Context**:
  - Technical Level: Advanced, provides high-level strategic direction.
  - Preferences: Prefers building the most complex version first and then simplifying for lower tiers.
  - Communication: Direct and decisive (e.g., "Do the highest premium tier first").

# Implementation Status
## Current State
- **Active Feature**: Server-driven OAuth 2.0 flow for the Premium tier.
- **Progress**: The assistant provided a bug fix for the previous "Help Modal" feature, but work on it has been paused by the user's new directive. Development is now starting on the premium feature.
- **Blockers**: The "Help Modal" bug is no longer a priority. The new challenge is implementing the complex server-side logic for the OAuth flow.

## Code Evolution
- **Recent Changes**: Assistant provided a full code update for `index.html` and `style.css` to fix a previous error and update the design system.
- **Working Patterns**: User sets the high-level strategy (e.g., "build premium first"), and the assistant is expected to implement it.
- **Failed Approaches**: The "fix the Standard tier modal first" approach was abandoned in favor of prioritizing the Premium tier.

# Requirements
- **Implemented**: Project setup, Direct user image upload, "Auto Shutdown" feature, Multi-AI model selection, Automatic labeling for Blogger posts.
- **In Progress**: Server-driven OAuth 2.0 authentication flow (Premium Tier).
- **Pending**: API key help modal (Standard Tier) and other standard-tier features.
- **Technical Constraints**: The new OAuth flow requires significant backend logic for handling secrets and tokens securely.

# Critical Memory
- **Must Preserve**: The core strategy is now "Premium First". Build the full-featured version and then create a simplified version from it.
- **User Requirements**: The premium version must be extremely simple for the end-user, requiring only a "Login with Google" click and consent.
- **Known Issues**: An error exists in the code for the (now deprioritized) "Help Modal" feature.

# Next Actions
- **Immediate**: Begin development of the server-driven OAuth 2.0 flow for the premium version.
- **Open Questions**: What backend framework and database should be used for managing user credentials and tokens for the OAuth flow?

---

annotations.summary:
---
# Project Overview
- **Project**: rastver5 - A web application for automated content generation and posting.
- **Current Phase**: Premium Tier Implementation & Deployment Planning
- **Tech Stack**: JavaScript, Node.js, Express, Vite, HTML, CSS, youtube-transcript, ytdl-core
- **Environment**: Local dual-server (Vite + Node), preparing for PaaS deployment on Render.

# Conversation Context
- **Last Topic**: Choosing a server deployment strategy for the application.
- **Key Decisions**: The application will be deployed on a PaaS (Platform as a Service), specifically **Render**, to ensure 24/7 availability. MongoDB Atlas will continue to be used for the database.
- **User Context**:
  - Technical Level: Advanced, provides high-level strategic direction (e.g., deployment platform choice).
  - Preferences: Prefers robust, scalable solutions (PaaS over self-hosting) and building the most complex version first.
  - Communication: Direct and decisive.

# Implementation Status
## Current State
- **Active Feature**: Preparing the application for cloud deployment on Render.
- **Progress**: The server-driven OAuth 2.0 flow for the Premium tier is fully implemented and functional in the local environment. The architecture has been successfully refactored to use a Vite dev server for the frontend and a separate Node.js server for the backend.
- **Blockers**: No technical blockers. The next step is the physical deployment to the chosen PaaS.

## Code Evolution
- **Recent Changes**: A major refactor was completed to implement server-driven OAuth. This introduced `Vite`, separated frontend/backend concerns, and moved all authentication logic to `server.js`. `package.json` was updated with new scripts (`dev`, `start`) and dependencies.
- **Working Patterns**: The assistant implements complete features based on the user's high-level directives. The user then provides the next strategic goal (e.g., deployment).
- **Failed Approaches**: The initial client-side handling of OAuth credentials has been completely removed and replaced by the more secure server-side flow.

# Requirements
- **Implemented**: Project setup, Direct user image upload, "Auto Shutdown", Multi-AI model selection, Automatic labeling, Server-driven OAuth 2.0 (Premium Tier).
- **In Progress**: Deploying the application to a production environment on Render.
- **Pending**: Deriving the "Standard" tier from the completed Premium version.
- **Technical Constraints**: The application must be deployable on Render, with all secrets (API keys, client secrets) managed as environment variables on the platform.

# Critical Memory
- **Must Preserve**: The "Premium First" strategy is active. The application architecture is now a distinct frontend (Vite) and backend (Node/Express). **Render** is the chosen deployment platform. The Google OAuth redirect URI for local development is `http://127.0.0.1:5001/auth/google/callback`.
- **User Requirements**: The final service must be stable, secure, and run 24/7 without requiring the user's local machine to be on.
- **Known Issues**: The "Help Modal" feature for the standard tier remains deprioritized.

# Next Actions
- **Immediate**: Deploy the application to Render by following the user's provided steps: push code to GitHub, create a 'Web Service' on Render, and configure the environment variables.
- **Open Questions**: What will the final production URL from Render be? (This is needed to update the Google OAuth 'Authorized redirect URIs').

      "name": "ai-auto-blogging-tool",
      "version": "1.0.0",

  - Communication: Direct, asks for confirmation on project state.

# Implementation Status
## Current State
- **Active Feature**: Verifying the complete application in the local environment before deployment.
- **Progress**: The user attempted to run the project locally. `npm install` was successful, but `npm run dev` failed.
- **Blockers**: The command `npm run dev` is failing with a "Missing script: 'dev'" error, preventing the user from testing the application locally.

## Code Evolution
- **Recent Changes**: A major refactor was completed to implement server-driven OAuth using a separate Vite frontend and Node.js backend.
- **Working Patterns**: The assistant provides complete feature implementations based on user's high-level goals.
- **Failed Approaches**: The user's attempt to run the local development server with `npm run dev` failed.

# Requirements
- **Implemented**: Project setup, Direct user image upload, "Auto Shutdown", Multi-AI model selection, Automatic labeling, Server-driven OAuth 2.0 (Premium Tier).

- **Pending**: Deriving the "Standard" tier from the completed Premium version.

# Critical Memory
- **Must Preserve**: The "Premium First" strategy is active. The architecture is a distinct frontend (Vite) and backend (Node/Express). **Render** is the chosen deployment platform. The user is concerned about whether the premium features are saved in the code they are testing.
- **User Requirements**: The final service must be stable, secure, and run 24/7.

# Next Actions
- **Immediate**: Diagnose why the `npm run dev` script is missing from the user's project version. This likely requires inspecting the `scripts` section of their `package.json`.
- **Open Questions**: Is the user working with the correct and most recent version of the code that includes the `dev` script? Why is their local copy missing the script?

annotations.summary:
---
# Project Overview
- **Project**: rastver5 - A web application for automated content generation and posting.
- **Current Phase**: Production Deployment
- **Tech Stack**: JavaScript, Node.js, Express, Vite, HTML, CSS, youtube-transcript, ytdl-core
- **Environment**: Local dual-server (Vite + Node), deploying to PaaS (Render).

# Conversation Context
- **Last Topic**: Finalizing the deployment strategy and steps for deploying the application on a PaaS.
- **Key Decisions**: **Render** is confirmed as the chosen PaaS for hosting the Node.js backend. MongoDB Atlas will continue to be used for the database. The local execution error (`npm run dev`) was resolved.
- **User Context**:
  - Technical Level: Advanced; capable of providing detailed architectural and deployment strategy explanations.
  - Preferences: Prefers robust, scalable PaaS solutions. Values clear, step-by-step deployment plans.
  - Communication: Collaborative; provides strategic direction and confirms technical choices.

# Implementation Status
## Current State
- **Active Feature**: Deploying the application to the Render platform.
- **Progress**: The local development environment is now fixed and runnable via `npm run dev`. A detailed deployment plan for Render has been established.
- **Blockers**: No technical blockers. The next phase involves executing the deployment steps on the Render platform.

## Code Evolution
- **Recent Changes**: `package.json` was fixed to include the `dev` script for local development. A `start` script (`node server.js`) was identified as necessary for production deployment on Render.
- **Working Patterns**: The assistant successfully resolved a configuration issue (`missing dev script`) with a direct code fix. The user provided a comprehensive deployment strategy.
- **Failed Approaches**: The initial attempt to run the local server failed due to a missing script, which has since been corrected.

# Requirements
- **Implemented**: Project setup, Direct user image upload, "Auto Shutdown", Multi-AI model selection, Automatic labeling, Server-driven OAuth 2.0, Functioning local development environment.
- **In Progress**: Executing the deployment of the application to a production environment on Render.
- **Pending**: Deriving the "Standard" tier from the completed Premium version after successful deployment.
- **Technical Constraints**: The application must be deployable on Render. All secrets (API keys, DB URI) must be managed as environment variables in the Render dashboard. `package.json` must contain a `start` script.

# Critical Memory
- **Must Preserve**: The deployment target is **Render** for the web service and **MongoDB Atlas** for the database. The "Premium First" development strategy is still in effect. The deployment requires a `start` script in `package.json` and setting environment variables in the Render UI.
- **User Requirements**: The final service must be stable, secure, and run 24/7 on a managed platform, freeing the developer from server maintenance tasks.
- **Known Issues**: The previous "Missing script: 'dev'" error has been resolved. No new issues are documented.

# Next Actions
- **Immediate**: Execute the deployment to Render following the user-defined plan: 1. Prepare code (add `start` script). 2. Link GitHub to Render. 3. Create a "Web Service". 4. Configure environment variables. 5. Trigger deployment.
- **Open Questions**: Are there any Render-specific configurations (e.g., Node version, build commands) that need to be set beyond the defaults?

} .history-title { font-weight: 500; flex-grow: 1; } .history-details { display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 1rem; flex-shrink: 0; } .history-date { font-size: 0.875rem; color: var(--text-secondary-light); } body[data-theme="dark"] .history-date { color: var(--text-secondary-dark); } .history-link { background-color: var(--primary-accent); color: white; padding: 0.375rem 0.75rem; border-radius: 0.25rem; text-decoration: none; font-size: 0.875rem; font-weight: 500; transition: var(--transition-fast); } .history-link:hover { background-color: #2563eb; } .history-placeholder { text-align: center; color: var(--text-secondary-light); padding: 2rem; list-style: none; border: 2px dashed var(--border-light); border-radius: var(--border-radius); } body[data-theme="dark"] .history-placeholder { color: var(--text-secondary-dark); border-color: var(--border-dark); } /* --- 6. Modal Styles --- */ .modal-backdrop { position: fixed; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6); display: flex; justify-content: center; align-items: center; z-index: 1000; backdrop-filter: blur(5px); } .modal-content { background-color: var(--card-bg-light); padding: 2rem; border-radius: var(--border-radius); box-shadow: var(--box-shadow-lg); width: 90%; max-width: 800px; max-height: 90vh; display: flex; flex-direction: column; border: 1px solid var(--border-light); } body[data-theme="dark"] .modal-content { background-color: var(--card-bg-dark); border-color: var(--border-dark); } .modal-header { display: flex; justify-content: space-between; align-items: center; border-bottom: 1px solid var(--border-light); padding-bottom: 1rem; margin-bottom: 1.5rem; } body[data-theme="dark"] .modal-header { border-bottom-color: var(--border-dark); } .modal-header h2 { margin: 0; padding: 0; border: none; } .modal-close-btn { background: none; border: none; font-size: 1.75rem; cursor: pointer; color: var(--text-secondary-light); } body[data-theme="dark"] .modal-close-btn { color: var(--text-secondary-dark); } .modal-body { overflow-y: auto; } .modal-footer { display: flex; justify-content: flex-end; gap: 1rem; padding-top: 1.5rem; margin-top: 1.5rem; border-top: 1px solid var(--border-light); } body[data-theme="dark"] .modal-footer { border-top-color: var(--border-dark); } /* --- 7. Utility & New Feature Styles --- */ .hidden { display: none !important; } .divider { border: none; border-top: 1px solid var(--border-light); margin: 1.5rem 0; } body[data-theme="dark"] .divider { border-top-color: var(--border-dark); } .warning-text { font-size: 0.8rem; color: var(--warning-color); margin-top: 0.5rem; padding: 0.5rem; background-color: rgba(249, 115, 22, 0.05); border-radius: 0.25rem; border-left: 3px solid var(--warning-color); } .shutdown-status-container { background-color: rgba(249, 115, 22, 0.1); border: 1px solid var(--warning-color); color: var(--warning-color); padding: 1rem; border-radius: var(--border-radius); display: flex; justify-content: space-between; align-items: center; font-weight: 600; } .shutdown-status-container p { margin: 0; } .shutdown-status-container .button-secondary { border-color: var(--warning-color); color: var(--warning-color); } .shutdown-status-container .button-secondary:hover { background-color: var(--warning-color); color: white; } /* --- 9. API Guide Styles --- */ .api-guide-steps { display: flex; flex-direction: column; gap: 1.25rem; } .api-guide-step { background-color: var(--summary-hover-bg-light); padding: 1.25rem; border-radius: var(--border-radius); border: 1px solid var(--border-light); transition: var(--transition-fast); } body[data-theme="dark"] .api-guide-step { background-color: var(--summary-hover-bg-dark); border-color: var(--border-dark); } .api-guide-step:hover { border-color: var(--primary-accent); transform: translateY(-2px); box-shadow: 0 2px 8px rgba(0,0,0,0.08); } .api-guide-step .step-header { display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 0.75rem; margin-bottom: 0.75rem; } .api-guide-step .step-number { background: var(--primary-gradient); color: white; width: 28px; height: 28px; border-radius: 50%; display: inline-flex; align-items: center; justify-content: center; font-weight: 700; flex-shrink: 0; } .api-guide-step h3 { margin: 0; font-size: 1.1rem; font-weight: 600; color: var(--text-primary-light); border: none; padding: 0; } body[data-theme="dark"] .api-guide-step h3 { color: var(--text-primary-dark); } .api-guide-step p { margin: 0 0 1.25rem 0; color: var(--text-secondary-light); font-size: 0.9rem; line-height: 1.5; } body[data-theme="dark"] .api-guide-step p { color: var(--text-secondary-dark); } .api-guide-step a.button-secondary { width: 100%; box-sizing: border-box; text-decoration: none; } .api-guide-step a.button-secondary::after { content: 'â†—'; font-family: sans-serif; font-weight: bold; display: inline-block; transition: transform 0.2s ease-out; margin-left: 0.25em; } .api-guide-step a.button-secondary:hover::after { transform: translate(2px, -2px); }

annotations.summary:
---
# Project Overview
- **Project**: Web Application Setup - Initializing a web project and integrating Google APIs.
- **Current Phase**: Feature Development
- **Tech Stack**: Node.js, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Google APIs (Gemini, OAuth)
- **Environment**: Local development environment using npm.

# Conversation Context
- **Last Topic**: Request for a feature to simplify obtaining Google API credentials.
- **Key Decisions**: The missing `dev` script in `package.json` was fixed. A new feature for guiding users to get Google API keys was requested.
- **User Context**:
  - Technical Level: Familiar with basic npm, now moving to API integration.
  - Preferences: Wants features that simplify complex external processes (like API key generation).
  - Communication: Communicates in Korean.

# Implementation Status
## Current State
- **Active Feature**: Google API Credential Helper
- **Progress**: The local development server is now running. The new feature is in the request/design phase.
- **Blockers**: None. Awaiting implementation of the new feature.

## Code Evolution
- **Recent Changes**: Added the `dev` script to `package.json` to enable the local server startup.
- **Working Patterns**: Successfully fixed project configuration using a `boltArtifact`.
- **Failed Approaches**: The initial attempt to run `npm run dev` failed due to a missing script.

# Requirements
- **Implemented**: Project file restoration, dependency installation, local server startup script (`npm run dev`).
- **In Progress**: Feature to guide users in obtaining Google API Key, OAuth Client ID, and Project ID.
- **Pending**: Implementation of the actual API integration after credentials are obtained.
- **Technical Constraints**: The project relies on npm scripts and will require interaction with Google Cloud services.

# Critical Memory
- **Must Preserve**: The local development environment is now functional. The focus has shifted to Google API integration.
- **User Requirements**: The user wants a streamlined, guided process with explanations and direct links to get various Google Cloud credentials.
- **Known Issues**: The `npm run dev` issue has been resolved.

# Next Actions
- **Immediate**: Design and implement the feature to guide the user through obtaining Google API credentials.
- **Open Questions**: What is the best user interface for guiding the user through the Google Cloud Console?
